title: How to Use PokEdit

steps.headline: Power on your Nintendo handheld game console.
steps.description: PokEdit is compatible with the 3DS, 3DS XL, DSi, DSi XL, DS, and the DS Lite.

steps.headline: Select “System Settings,” then select “Internet Settings.”
steps.description: Select “Nintendo WFC Settings” and tap on the big blue button to access Internet Settings if using a DS or DS Lite.

steps.headline: Select “Connection Settings,” then select the network connection you normally use when playing online.
Click on the right arrow until you see the DNS option, then select “DNS.”
Select “No” next to “Auto-Obtain DNS,” then select “Detailed Setup.”
Select “Primary DNS,” then enter “023.239.001.212” as the DNS.
steps.description: This allows you to connect to the PokEdit server so you can obtain your Pokémon character.

steps.headline: Select “OK,” then select “Save.” You are now ready to create a Pokémon character.
Navigate to the official PokEdit website at http://www.pokedit.com/ using your computer or device.
steps.description: Your Nintendo console and computer must be connected to the same network for this method to work.

steps.headline: Click on the editor “gear” icon at the top of the landing page, then click on the “Pokemon” tab.
steps.description: A list of popular Pokémon characters will display on-screen.

steps.headline: Select the Pokémon character you want to edit.
steps.description: Basic details about that particular Pokémon character will display on-screen, such as its gender, appearance, special abilities, and more.

steps.headline: Edit the Pokémon character as desired.
steps.description: You can change its name, level, gender, language, held items, abilities, moves, mood, stats, hatch location, and more.

steps.headline: Click on “Apply Edits,” then click on “Send to Game.” The Pokémon character will be sent directly to your Nintendo console and saved to the GTS Queue.
steps.description: GTS stands for Global Telecommunications System, which is the Internet protocol your Nintendo console uses to communicate with your network and the PokEdit server.

steps.headline: Launch your Pokémon game and navigate to the Global Terminal in your game.
steps.description: The Global Terminal is located at the Pokémon Center for the Black and White editions, in Goldenrod City for the HeartGold and SoulSilver editions, and in Jubilife City for the Platinum, Diamond, and Pearl editions.

steps.headline: Navigate to the woman and select “Global Trade.” If using the Black and White editions, navigate to the woman standing in the very back of the Pokémon Center to the far right and select “Global Trade.”
Select “Yes” when asked if you want to save and continue game progress.
steps.description: Your character will drop into the GTS room, and you’ll be awarded with the new Pokémon character you created using PokEdit.

text: Changing Your Internet Settings Power on your Nintendo handheld game console. PokEdit is compatible with the 3DS, 3DS XL, DSi, DSi XL, DS, and the DS Lite. Select “System Settings,” then select “Internet Settings.” Select “Nintendo WFC Settings” and tap on the big blue button to access Internet Settings if using a DS or DS Lite. Select “Connection Settings,” then select the network connection you normally use when playing online.  Click on the right arrow until you see the DNS option, then select “DNS.”  Select “No” next to “Auto-Obtain DNS,” then select “Detailed Setup.”  Select “Primary DNS,” then enter “023.239.001.212” as the DNS. This allows you to connect to the PokEdit server so you can obtain your Pokémon character. Select “OK,” then select “Save.” You are now ready to create a Pokémon character.  Creating Your Pokemon Character Navigate to the official PokEdit website at http://www.pokedit.com/ using your computer or device. Your Nintendo console and computer must be connected to the same network for this method to work. Click on the editor “gear” icon at the top of the landing page, then click on the “Pokemon” tab. A list of popular Pokémon characters will display on-screen. Select the Pokémon character you want to edit. Basic details about that particular Pokémon character will display on-screen, such as its gender, appearance, special abilities, and more. Edit the Pokémon character as desired. You can change its name, level, gender, language, held items, abilities, moves, mood, stats, hatch location, and more. Click on “Apply Edits,” then click on “Send to Game.” The Pokémon character will be sent directly to your Nintendo console and saved to the GTS Queue. GTS stands for Global Telecommunications System, which is the Internet protocol your Nintendo console uses to communicate with your network and the PokEdit server. Receiving Your Pokemon Character Launch your Pokémon game and navigate to the Global Terminal in your game. The Global Terminal is located at the Pokémon Center for the Black and White editions, in Goldenrod City for the HeartGold and SoulSilver editions, and in Jubilife City for the Platinum, Diamond, and Pearl editions. Navigate to the woman and select “Global Trade.” If using the Black and White editions, navigate to the woman standing in the very back of the Pokémon Center to the far right and select “Global Trade.”  Select “GTS,” then select “Trade.”  Select “Yes” when asked if you want to save and continue game progress. Your character will drop into the GTS room, and you’ll be awarded with the new Pokémon character you created using PokEdit.
